title: Add cPanel self-hosting setup guide and ensure deployment docs are included in the built frontend

requirements.text: Create or update a user-facing documentation page (English) that explains how to self-host the React frontend on a shared hosting server using cPanel, including exactly where to upload files for (a) a primary domain and (b) an addon domain or subdomain, and how to configure the app when hosted in a subdirectory.

quotes: Now make it so i can host it my self on my shred hosting server with a how to upload doc to tell me how to setup and where to put the files in my cPanel domain

acceptanceCriteria: The documentation includes a step-by-step build section (how to generate the production static files) and an upload section (what folder(s) in cPanel to upload into, e.g., public_html / addon domain docroot).

The documentation explains how to host the app at the domain root vs. in a subdirectory and explicitly documents how to set the correct BASE_URL for subdirectory hosting (consistent with frontend/src/utils/assetPaths.ts using import.meta.env.BASE_URL).

The documentation explicitly states that the Motoko backend cannot run on cPanel/shared hosting and must remain deployed on the Internet Computer, while the frontend can be self-hosted as static files.
The documentation includes verification steps (what URLs to open, what to click) and a troubleshooting section relevant to cPanel/static hosting.

requirements.text: Ensure the deployment/how-to documentation is shipped with the production frontend build and is accessible from the existing “Deployment Guide” footer link (currently linking to getDocumentUrl('DEPLOYMENT.md')).

quotes: how to upload doc to tell me how to setup and where to put the files in my cPanel domain

acceptanceCriteria: After building the frontend for production, the documentation file is present in the generated static output and can be opened in a browser from the running site.
Clicking the footer “Deployment Guide” link opens the documentation successfully when the app is hosted on a static server (including cPanel).
No changes are made to any frontend immutablePaths files.

requirements.text: Add a cPanel-friendly static-hosting configuration snippet (as a file included with the frontend static assets) and document when/how to use it (e.g., optional .htaccess for caching/compression and any SPA-related settings that apply).

quotes: host it my self on my shred hosting server ... setup and where to put the files in my cPanel domain

acceptanceCriteria: A ready-to-upload configuration file is included alongside the built frontend static files (suitable for typical Apache-based cPanel hosting).
The documentation explains where to place the configuration file in the cPanel file manager and what to do if the hosting environment does not support the configuration directives.
The configuration guidance does not assume server-side runtimes; it remains compatible with pure static hosting.

constraints: Do not propose or implement running the Motoko backend on shared hosting/cPanel; only the static React frontend can be self-hosted there.
Do not edit files under frontend/immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new hosting providers or deployment targets beyond shared hosting (cPanel) static hosting instructions.
Adding third-party authentication methods beyond Internet Identity.
Replacing hash-based routing with a different routing strategy.
